intro: Lacinaria scariosa var. galli, commonly known as the scarlet lacinaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in a thin, papery layer. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a delicate, shade-tolerant plant.
